Two viral videos were analyzed: both claiming that Muslim people were hoarding food supplies and wasting food during the lockdown. The videos showed individuals reporting from slums and a leprosy ashram, showcasing food items and stacks of pooris.
Alt News received several requests to fa: check the claim on WhatsApp and their official Android application, indicating widespread concern and interest in the authenticity of the claim.
A Facebook page called Najafgarh Confess: suggesting that the claim was being shared without any manipulative agenda.
A Facebook user named Kumar Ajit posted: Food Jihad," implying a deliberate attempt to create animosity between Hindu and Muslim communities. This post received significant views and shares, indicating the potential for the claim to incite religious tensions.
